Welcome to contacts-api’s documentation!¶

contacts-api main¶

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is used to check if the database is correctly configured. It will return a 500 error code if something goes wrong, otherwise it will return a 200 OK.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

async main.root()¶

The root function returns a JSON object with the message &quot;Hi! I am FastAPI applicataion!&quot;

Returns:

A dict, which is converted to a json response

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the whole application, like database connections or caches.

Returns:

A coroutine, which means it’s a function that

contacts-api repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(user_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

Create Contact to database.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – For wich user id will create contact

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact fields

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

Created Contact

Return type:

201 | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user_id: int, db: Session)¶

Return Conctact by id from database

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Contact id for searching

  • user_id (int) – For wich user id get all contacts

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

Contact with searching id

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user_id: int, db: Session)¶

Return all contacts from database.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – For wich user id get all contacts

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

All contacts for set user_id

Return type:

[Contacts] | []

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user_id: int, db: Session)¶

Remove contact from database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Contact id for deleting

  • user_id (int) – For wich user id get all contacts

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

Status code 204 - No content

Return type:

None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, user_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

Update contact in database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Contact id for deleting

  • user_id (int) – For wich user id get all contacts

  • body (ContactModel) – Fields for updating

  • db (Session) – database session

Returns:

Updated Contact

Return type:

Contact

contacts-api repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.change_password(email: str, new_password: str, db: Session)¶

The change_password function takes an email and a new password, and changes the user’s password to the new one.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Identify the user to change the password for

  • new_password – str: Pass in the new password that the user wants to change their password to

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

async src.repository.users.confirm_email(email: str, db: Session)¶

The confirm_email function takes an email and a database session as arguments. It then uses the get_user_by_email function to retrieve the user with that email from the database. The confirm_email function then sets that user’s confirmed field to True, and commits those changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass the user model to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A new user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A user object if a user with the given email exists in the database, otherwise it returns none

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function takes an email and a url, and updates the avatar of the user with that email to be the given url. It returns the updated user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to update

  • url – str: Pass the url of the avatar to be updated

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶

The update_token function takes in a user object, a refresh token string, and a database session. It then updates the user’s refresh_token attribute to be the new value of the refresh_token parameter. Finally it commits this change to the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user in the database

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

contacts-api routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their email address. Then, it checks if there is a user with that email in the database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in the database, then we check whether or not they have already confirmed their account.

If they have already confirmed their account (i.e., if ‘confirmed’ == True), then we return another helpful message saying so; otherwise (i.e

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message confirming that the user’s email has been confirmed

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user. It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address, and uses this information to find the corresponding UserModel object in our database. If the UserModel exists (i.e., if there is already an account associated with that email), then we check whether the account has been confirmed yet or not; if it hasn’t been confirmed yet, then we add a task for sending an email confirmation message using Celery.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A message to the user

async src.routes.auth.request_reset_password(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The request_reset_password function is used to request a password reset for the user with the given email.

The function will send an email to that user containing a link which they can use to reset their password. This endpoint does not require authentication.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Run the reset_password function in a background thread

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A message to the user that we have sent a new password on his email

async src.routes.auth.set_new_password(token: str, new_password: str, confirm_new_password: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The set_new_password function takes in a token, new_password and confirm_new_password. It then gets the email from the token using auth service. It then gets the user by email from db. If there is no user with that email it raises an error 400 bad request saying verification error. If passwords do not match it raises an error 400 bad request saying passwords not same.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • new_password – str: Set the new password for the user

  • confirm_new_password – str: Ensure that the user has entered the same password twice

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dict with a message

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account with that email already exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url for sending the email

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A new user

contacts-api routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes in a ContactModel object and returns the newly created contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the contact information from the request

  • db – Session: Create a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id of the current logged in user

Returns:

A contactmodel object

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer, contact_id, and uses it to find the corresponding ContactModel object in the database. If no such object is found, then a 404 error is raised. Otherwise, if such an object exists and belongs to current_user (the user who made this request), then that ContactModel object is deleted.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user and pass it to the repository function

Returns:

The deleted contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(key: str = None, value: str = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • key – str: Specify the key of the search

  • value – str: Get the value of a specific key

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The list of contacts for the current user

async src.routes.contacts.startup()¶
async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id of the contact to be updated, and a body containing all fields that need to be updated. If no such contact exists, it returns 404 Not Found.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id of the logged in user

Returns:

A contactmodel object

contacts-api routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

The function takes in a User object, which is passed to it by the auth_service module. This User object contains all of the information about the current user, and this function simply returns it.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function takes a file and the current user as input. It then uploads the file to Cloudinary, generates a public_id for it, and gets its src_url. Finally, it updates the avatar of the current user with this new src_url.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Get a database session, which is required for interacting with the database

Returns:

The user object

contacts-api service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Authorization¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'main_key'¶
c = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=redis-16800.c265.us-east-1-2.ec2.cloud.redislabs.com,port=16800,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary of key-value pairs to include in the JWT payload. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional timedelta indicating how long the token should be valid for. Defaults to 15 minutes if not provided.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • data – dict: Pass in the data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

An encoded access token

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function creates a token that is used to verify the user’s email address. The token is created using the JWT library and contains information about when it was issued, when it expires, and what scope (or purpose) it has. The function returns this token.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a jwt

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email and a timestamp

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

The function takes in two parameters: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary containing the user’s email, username, and password. Expires_delta is an optional parameter that sets how long until the refresh token expires.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function decodes the refresh token and returns the email of the user. If there is an error, it will raise a HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized)

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that is sent from the frontend

Returns:

The email of the user

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
get_email_from_token(token: str)¶
The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token.

If the scope of the payload is not ‘email_token’, then it raises an HTTPException. If there is a JWTError, then it also raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email address

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password and returns the hashed version of that password. The hashing algorithm is defined in the config file, which is passed to CryptContext when it’s created.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, password: str)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password, and verifies that the plain-text password matches the hashed password. It returns True if they match, or False otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Check the password that is entered by the user

  • password – str: Verify the password

Returns:

True if the password is correct and false otherwise

contacts-api service Cloudinary¶

class src.services.cloudinary_service.CloudImage¶

Bases: object

static genereate_name_avatar(email: str)¶

The genereate_name_avatar function takes an email address as a string and returns a unique avatar name. The function uses the hashlib module to generate a SHA256 hash of the email address, then truncates it to 10 characters. It then prepends &quot;avatars/&quot; to this string and returns it.

Parameters:

email – str: Specify the type of parameter that is expected

Returns:

A string with the name of an avatar

static get_url_for_avatar(public_id, r)¶

The get_url_for_avatar function takes in a public_id and an r (which is the result of a cloudinary.uploader.explicit call) and returns the url for that avatar image, which will be used to display it on the page.

Parameters:

  • public_id – Identify the image in cloudinary

  • r – Get the version of the image from cloudinary

Returns:

The url for the avatar image

static upload(file, public_id: str)¶

The upload function takes a file and public_id as arguments. The function then uploads the file to cloudinary using the public_id provided. If there is already an image with that id, it will be overwritten.

Parameters:

  • file – Specify the file to be uploaded

  • public_id – str: Set the public_id of the image to be uploaded

Returns:

A dictionary of the uploaded file’s information

contacts-api service Email¶

async src.services.email_service.reset_password(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The reset_password function sends an email to the user with a link to reset their password.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Personalize the email

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email

Returns:

A connectionerrors exception if the connection fails

async src.services.email_service.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address. The function takes in three arguments:

-email: The user’s email address, which is used as the recipient of the message. -username: The username of the user, which is used in both subject and body of message. -host: The hostname for where this application is running (e.g., localhost). This will be

included in a link that users can click on to verify their account.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username of the user to be registered

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine object
